14namespace v8 {
15namespace internal {

17class CodeReference;
18class EmbeddedData;
19
20// Specifies whether to perform icache flush operations on RelocInfo updates.
21// If FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED, the icache will always be flushed if an
22// instruction was modified. If SKIP_ICACHE_FLUSH the flush will always be
23// skipped (only use this if you will flush the icache manually before it is
24// executed).
25enum ICacheFlushMode { FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED, SKIP_ICACHE_FLUSH };
26
27namespace detail {
28// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
29// Implementation of RelocInfoWriter and RelocIterator
30//
31// Relocation information is written backwards in memory, from high addresses
32// towards low addresses, byte by byte. Therefore, in the encodings listed
33// below, the first byte listed it at the highest address, and successive
34// bytes in the record are at progressively lower addresses.
35//
36// Encoding
37//
38// The most common modes are given single-byte encodings. Also, it is
39// easy to identify the type of reloc info and skip unwanted modes in
40// an iteration.
41//
42// The encoding relies on the fact that there are fewer than 14
43// different relocation modes using standard non-compact encoding.
44//
45// The first byte of a relocation record has a tag in its low 2 bits:
46// Here are the record schemes, depending on the low tag and optional higher
47// tags.
48//
49// Low tag:
50// 00: embedded_object: [6-bit pc delta] 00
51//
52// 01: code_target: [6-bit pc delta] 01
53//
54// 10: wasm_stub_call: [6-bit pc delta] 10
55//
56// 11: long_record [6 bit reloc mode] 11
57// followed by pc delta
58// followed by optional data depending on type.
59//
60// If a pc delta exceeds 6 bits, it is split into a remainder that fits into
61// 6 bits and a part that does not. The latter is encoded as a long record
62// with PC_JUMP as pseudo reloc info mode. The former is encoded as part of
63// the following record in the usual way. The long pc jump record has variable
64// length:
65// pc-jump: [PC_JUMP] 11
66// 1 [7 bits data]
67// ...
68// 0 [7 bits data]
69// (Bits 6..31 of pc delta, encoded with VLQ.)
70
71constexpr int kTagBits = 2;
72constexpr int kTagMask = (1 << kTagBits) - 1;
73constexpr int kLongTagBits = 6;
74
75constexpr int kEmbeddedObjectTag = 0;
76constexpr int kCodeTargetTag = 1;
77constexpr int kWasmStubCallTag = 2;
78constexpr int kDefaultTag = 3;
79
80constexpr int kSmallPCDeltaBits = kBitsPerByte - kTagBits;
81constexpr int kSmallPCDeltaMask = (1 << kSmallPCDeltaBits) - 1;
82} // namespace detail
83
84// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
85// Relocation information
86
87// Relocation information consists of the address (pc) of the datum
88// to which the relocation information applies, the relocation mode
89// (rmode), and an optional data field. The relocation mode may be
90// "descriptive" and not indicate a need for relocation, but simply
91// describe a property of the datum. Such rmodes are useful for GC
92// and nice disassembly output.
93
94class RelocInfo {
95 public:
96 // The minimum size of a comment is equal to two bytes for the extra tagged
97 // pc and kSystemPointerSize for the actual pointer to the comment.
98 static constexpr int kMinRelocCommentSize = 2 + kSystemPointerSize;
99
100 // The maximum size for a call instruction including pc-jump.
101 static constexpr int kMaxCallSize = 6;
102
103 // The maximum pc delta that will use the short encoding.
104 static constexpr int kMaxSmallPCDelta = detail::kSmallPCDeltaMask;
105
106 enum Mode : int8_t {
107 // Please note the order is important (see IsRealRelocMode, IsGCRelocMode,
108 // and IsShareableRelocMode predicates below).
109
110 NO_INFO, // Never recorded value. Most common one, hence value 0.
111
112 CODE_TARGET,
113 // TODO(ishell): rename to NEAR_CODE_TARGET.
114 RELATIVE_CODE_TARGET, // LAST_CODE_TARGET_MODE
115 COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT,
116 FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT, // LAST_GCED_ENUM
117
118 WASM_CALL, // FIRST_SHAREABLE_RELOC_MODE
119 WASM_STUB_CALL,
120
121 EXTERNAL_REFERENCE, // The address of an external C++ function.
122 INTERNAL_REFERENCE, // An address inside the same function.
123
124 // The relative address (target-table) in the switch table.
125 RELATIVE_SWITCH_TABLE_ENTRY,
126
127 // Encoded internal reference, used only on RISCV64, RISCV32, MIPS64
128 // and PPC.
129 INTERNAL_REFERENCE_ENCODED,
130
131 // An off-heap instruction stream target. See http://goo.gl/Z2HUiM.
132 // TODO(ishell): rename to BUILTIN_ENTRY.
133 OFF_HEAP_TARGET, // FIRST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE
134 // An un-embedded off-heap instruction stream target.
135 // See http://crbug.com/v8/11527 for details.
136 NEAR_BUILTIN_ENTRY, // LAST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE
137
138 // Marks constant and veneer pools. Only used on ARM and ARM64.
139 // They use a custom noncompact encoding.
140 CONST_POOL,
141 VENEER_POOL,
142
143 DEOPT_SCRIPT_OFFSET,
144 DEOPT_INLINING_ID, // Deoptimization source position.
145 DEOPT_REASON, // Deoptimization reason index.
146 DEOPT_ID, // Deoptimization inlining id.
147 DEOPT_NODE_ID, // Id of the node that caused deoptimization. This
148 // information is only recorded in debug builds.
149
150 // This is not an actual reloc mode, but used to encode a long pc jump that
151 // cannot be encoded as part of another record.
152 PC_JUMP,
153
154 // Pseudo-types
155 NUMBER_OF_MODES,
156
157 LAST_CODE_TARGET_MODE = RELATIVE_CODE_TARGET,
158 FIRST_REAL_RELOC_MODE = CODE_TARGET,
159 LAST_REAL_RELOC_MODE = VENEER_POOL,
160 FIRST_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_RELOC_MODE = COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT,
161 LAST_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_RELOC_MODE = FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT,
162 LAST_GCED_ENUM = LAST_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_RELOC_MODE,
163 FIRST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE = OFF_HEAP_TARGET,
164 LAST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE = NEAR_BUILTIN_ENTRY,
165 FIRST_SHAREABLE_RELOC_MODE = WASM_CALL,
166 };
167
168 static_assert(NUMBER_OF_MODES <= kBitsPerInt);
169
170 RelocInfo() = default;
171
172 RelocInfo(Address pc, Mode rmode, intptr_t data,
173 Address constant_pool = kNullAddress)
174 : pc_(pc), rmode_(rmode), data_(data), constant_pool_(constant_pool) {
175 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOL,
176 rmode != COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT);
177 }
178
179 // Convenience ctor.
180 RelocInfo(Address pc, Mode rmode) : RelocInfo(pc, rmode, 0) {}
181
182 static constexpr bool IsRealRelocMode(Mode mode) {
183 return mode >= FIRST_REAL_RELOC_MODE && mode <= LAST_REAL_RELOC_MODE;
184 }
185 // Is the relocation mode affected by GC?
186 static constexpr bool IsGCRelocMode(Mode mode) {
187 return mode <= LAST_GCED_ENUM;
188 }
189 static constexpr bool IsShareableRelocMode(Mode mode) {
190 return mode == RelocInfo::NO_INFO ||
191 mode >= RelocInfo::FIRST_SHAREABLE_RELOC_MODE;
192 }
193 static constexpr bool IsCodeTarget(Mode mode) { return mode == CODE_TARGET; }
194 static constexpr bool IsCodeTargetMode(Mode mode) {
195 return mode <= LAST_CODE_TARGET_MODE;
196 }
197 static constexpr bool IsRelativeCodeTarget(Mode mode) {
198 return mode == RELATIVE_CODE_TARGET;
199 }
200 static constexpr bool IsFullEmbeddedObject(Mode mode) {
201 return mode == FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT;
202 }
203 static constexpr bool IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(Mode mode) {
204 return COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOL && mode == COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT;
205 }
206 static constexpr bool IsEmbeddedObjectMode(Mode mode) {
207 return base::IsInRange(mode, FIRST_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_RELOC_MODE,
208 LAST_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_RELOC_MODE);
209 }
210 static constexpr bool IsWasmCall(Mode mode) { return mode == WASM_CALL; }
211 static constexpr bool IsWasmReference(Mode mode) { return mode == WASM_CALL; }
212 static constexpr bool IsWasmStubCall(Mode mode) {
213 return mode == WASM_STUB_CALL;
214 }
215 static constexpr bool IsConstPool(Mode mode) { return mode == CONST_POOL; }
216 static constexpr bool IsVeneerPool(Mode mode) { return mode == VENEER_POOL; }
217 static constexpr bool IsDeoptPosition(Mode mode) {
218 return mode == DEOPT_SCRIPT_OFFSET || mode == DEOPT_INLINING_ID;
219 }
220 static constexpr bool IsDeoptReason(Mode mode) {
221 return mode == DEOPT_REASON;
222 }
223 static constexpr bool IsDeoptId(Mode mode) { return mode == DEOPT_ID; }
224 static constexpr bool IsDeoptNodeId(Mode mode) {
225 return mode == DEOPT_NODE_ID;
226 }
227 static constexpr bool IsExternalReference(Mode mode) {
228 return mode == EXTERNAL_REFERENCE;
229 }
230 static constexpr bool IsInternalReference(Mode mode) {
231 return mode == INTERNAL_REFERENCE;
232 }
233 static constexpr bool IsRelativeSwitchTableEntry(Mode mode) {
234 return mode == RELATIVE_SWITCH_TABLE_ENTRY;
235 }
236 static constexpr bool IsInternalReferenceEncoded(Mode mode) {
237 return mode == INTERNAL_REFERENCE_ENCODED;
238 }
239 static constexpr bool IsOffHeapTarget(Mode mode) {
240 return mode == OFF_HEAP_TARGET;
241 }
242 static constexpr bool IsNearBuiltinEntry(Mode mode) {
243 return mode == NEAR_BUILTIN_ENTRY;
244 }
245 static constexpr bool IsBuiltinEntryMode(Mode mode) {
246 return base::IsInRange(mode, FIRST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE,
247 LAST_BUILTIN_ENTRY_MODE);
248 }
249 static constexpr bool IsNoInfo(Mode mode) { return mode == NO_INFO; }
250
251 static bool IsOnlyForSerializer(Mode mode) {
252#ifdef V8_TARGET_ARCH_IA32
253 // On ia32, inlined off-heap trampolines must be relocated.
254 DCHECK_NE((kApplyMask & ModeMask(OFF_HEAP_TARGET)), 0);
255 DCHECK_EQ((kApplyMask & ModeMask(EXTERNAL_REFERENCE)), 0);
256 return mode == EXTERNAL_REFERENCE;
257#else
258 DCHECK_EQ((kApplyMask & ModeMask(OFF_HEAP_TARGET)), 0);
259 DCHECK_EQ((kApplyMask & ModeMask(EXTERNAL_REFERENCE)), 0);
260 return mode == EXTERNAL_REFERENCE || mode == OFF_HEAP_TARGET;
261#endif
262 }
263
264 static bool IsOnlyForDisassembler(Mode mode) {
265 return mode == RELATIVE_SWITCH_TABLE_ENTRY;
266 }
267
268 static constexpr int ModeMask(Mode mode) { return 1 << mode; }
269
270 // Accessors
271 Address pc() const { return pc_; }
272 Mode rmode() const { return rmode_; }
273 intptr_t data() const { return data_; }
274
275 // Is the pointer this relocation info refers to coded like a plain pointer
276 // or is it strange in some way (e.g. relative or patched into a series of
277 // instructions).
278 bool IsCodedSpecially();
279
280 // The static pendant to IsCodedSpecially, just for off-heap targets. Used
281 // during deserialization, when we don't actually have a RelocInfo handy.
282 static bool OffHeapTargetIsCodedSpecially();
283
284 // If true, the pointer this relocation info refers to is an entry in the
285 // constant pool, otherwise the pointer is embedded in the instruction stream.
286 bool IsInConstantPool();
287
288 Address wasm_call_address() const;
289 Address wasm_stub_call_address() const;
290
291 uint32_t wasm_call_tag() const;
292
293 void set_off_heap_target_address(
294 Address target,
295 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
296
297 // this relocation applies to;
298 // can only be called if IsCodeTarget(rmode_)
299 V8_INLINE Address target_address();
300 // Cage base value is used for decompressing compressed embedded references.
301 V8_INLINE Tagged<HeapObject> target_object(PtrComprCageBase cage_base);
302
303 V8_INLINE Handle<HeapObject> target_object_handle(Assembler* origin);
304
305 // Decodes builtin ID encoded as a PC-relative offset. This encoding is used
306 // during code generation of call/jump with NEAR_BUILTIN_ENTRY.
307 V8_INLINE Builtin target_builtin_at(Assembler* origin);
308 V8_INLINE Address target_off_heap_target();
309
310 // Returns the address of the constant pool entry where the target address
311 // is held. This should only be called if IsInConstantPool returns true.
312 V8_INLINE Address constant_pool_entry_address();
313
314 // Read the address of the word containing the target_address in an
315 // instruction stream. What this means exactly is architecture-independent.
316 // The only architecture-independent user of this function is the serializer.
317 // The serializer uses it to find out how many raw bytes of instruction to
318 // output before the next target. Architecture-independent code shouldn't
319 // dereference the pointer it gets back from this.
320 V8_INLINE Address target_address_address();
321 bool HasTargetAddressAddress() const;
322
323 // This indicates how much space a target takes up when deserializing a code
324 // stream. For most architectures this is just the size of a pointer. For
325 // an instruction like movw/movt where the target bits are mixed into the
326 // instruction bits the size of the target will be zero, indicating that the
327 // serializer should not step forwards in memory after a target is resolved
328 // and written. In this case the target_address_address function above
329 // should return the end of the instructions to be patched, allowing the
330 // deserializer to deserialize the instructions as raw bytes and put them in
331 // place, ready to be patched with the target.
332 V8_INLINE int target_address_size();
333
334 // Read the reference in the instruction this relocation
335 // applies to; can only be called if rmode_ is EXTERNAL_REFERENCE.
336 V8_INLINE Address target_external_reference();
337
338 // Read the reference in the instruction this relocation
339 // applies to; can only be called if rmode_ is INTERNAL_REFERENCE.
340 V8_INLINE Address target_internal_reference();
341
342 // Return the reference address this relocation applies to;
343 // can only be called if rmode_ is INTERNAL_REFERENCE.
344 V8_INLINE Address target_internal_reference_address();
345
346 template <typename ObjectVisitor>
347 void Visit(Tagged<InstructionStream> host, ObjectVisitor* visitor) {
348 Mode mode = rmode();
349 if (IsEmbeddedObjectMode(mode)) {
350 visitor->VisitEmbeddedPointer(host, this);
351 } else if (IsCodeTargetMode(mode)) {
352 visitor->VisitCodeTarget(host, this);
353 } else if (IsExternalReference(mode)) {
354 visitor->VisitExternalReference(host, this);
355 } else if (IsInternalReference(mode) || IsInternalReferenceEncoded(mode)) {
356 visitor->VisitInternalReference(host, this);
357 } else if (IsBuiltinEntryMode(mode)) {
358 visitor->VisitOffHeapTarget(host, this);
359 }
360 }
361
362#ifdef ENABLE_DISASSEMBLER
363 // Printing
364 static const char* RelocModeName(Mode rmode);
365 void Print(Isolate* isolate, std::ostream& os);
366#endif // ENABLE_DISASSEMBLER
367#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
368 void Verify(Isolate* isolate);
369#endif
370
371 static const int kApplyMask; // Modes affected by apply. Depends on arch.
372
373 static constexpr int AllRealModesMask() {
374 constexpr Mode kFirstUnrealRelocMode =
375 static_cast<Mode>(RelocInfo::LAST_REAL_RELOC_MODE + 1);
376 return (ModeMask(kFirstUnrealRelocMode) - 1) &
377 ~(ModeMask(RelocInfo::FIRST_REAL_RELOC_MODE) - 1);
378 }
379
380 static int EmbeddedObjectModeMask() {
381 return ModeMask(RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT) |
382 ModeMask(RelocInfo::COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT);
383 }
384
385 // In addition to modes covered by the apply mask (which is applied at GC
386 // time, among others), this covers all modes that are relocated by
387 // InstructionStream::CopyFromNoFlush after code generation.
388 static int PostCodegenRelocationMask() {
389 return ModeMask(RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET) |
390 ModeMask(RelocInfo::COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT) |
391 ModeMask(RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT) |
392 ModeMask(RelocInfo::NEAR_BUILTIN_ENTRY) |
393 ModeMask(RelocInfo::WASM_STUB_CALL) |
394 ModeMask(RelocInfo::RELATIVE_CODE_TARGET) | kApplyMask;
395 }
396
397 protected:
398 // On ARM/ARM64, note that pc_ is the address of the instruction referencing
399 // the constant pool and not the address of the constant pool entry.
400 Address pc_;
401 Mode rmode_;
402 intptr_t data_ = 0;
403 Address constant_pool_ = kNullAddress;
404
405 template <typename RelocIteratorType>
406 friend class RelocIteratorBase;
407};
408
409class WritableRelocInfo : public RelocInfo {
410 public:
411 WritableRelocInfo(WritableJitAllocation& jit_allocation, Address pc,
412 Mode rmode)
413 : RelocInfo(pc, rmode) {}
414 WritableRelocInfo(WritableJitAllocation& jit_allocation, Address pc,
415 Mode rmode, intptr_t data, Address constant_pool)
416 : RelocInfo(pc, rmode, data, constant_pool) {}
417
418 // Apply a relocation by delta bytes. When the code object is moved, PC
419 // relative addresses have to be updated as well as absolute addresses
420 // inside the code (internal references).
421 // Do not forget to flush the icache afterwards!
422 V8_INLINE void apply(intptr_t delta);
423
424 void set_wasm_call_address(
425 Address, ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
426 void set_wasm_stub_call_address(
427 Address, ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
428
429 void set_target_address(
430 Tagged<InstructionStream> host, Address target,
431 WriteBarrierMode write_barrier_mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER,
432 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
433 // Use this overload only when an InstructionStream host is not available.
434 void set_target_address(Address target, ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode =
435 FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
436
437 V8_INLINE void set_target_object(
438 Tagged<InstructionStream> host, Tagged<HeapObject> target,
439 WriteBarrierMode write_barrier_mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER,
440 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
441 // Use this overload only when an InstructionStream host is not available.
442 V8_INLINE void set_target_object(
443 Tagged<HeapObject> target,
444 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
445
446 V8_INLINE void set_target_external_reference(
447 Address, ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
448};
449
450// RelocInfoWriter serializes a stream of relocation info. It writes towards
451// lower addresses.
452class RelocInfoWriter {
453 public:
454 RelocInfoWriter() : pos_(nullptr), last_pc_(nullptr) {}
455
456 RelocInfoWriter(const RelocInfoWriter&) = delete;
457 RelocInfoWriter& operator=(const RelocInfoWriter&) = delete;
458
459 uint8_t* pos() const { return pos_; }
460 uint8_t* last_pc() const { return last_pc_; }
461
462 void Write(const RelocInfo* rinfo);
463
464 // Update the state of the stream after reloc info buffer
465 // and/or code is moved while the stream is active.
466 void Reposition(uint8_t* pos, uint8_t* pc) {
467 pos_ = pos;
468 last_pc_ = pc;
469 }
470
471 // Max size (bytes) of a written RelocInfo. Longest encoding is
472 // ExtraTag, VariableLengthPCJump, ExtraTag, pc_delta, data_delta.
473 static constexpr int kMaxSize = 1 + 4 + 1 + 1 + kSystemPointerSize;
474
475 private:
476 inline uint32_t WriteLongPCJump(uint32_t pc_delta);
477
478 inline void WriteShortTaggedPC(uint32_t pc_delta, int tag);
479 inline void WriteShortData(intptr_t data_delta);
480
481 inline void WriteMode(RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
482 inline void WriteModeAndPC(uint32_t pc_delta, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
483 inline void WriteIntData(int data_delta);
484
485 uint8_t* pos_;
486 uint8_t* last_pc_;
487};
488
489// A RelocIterator iterates over relocation information.
490// Typical use:
491//
492// for (RelocIterator it(code); !it.done(); it.next()) {
493// // do something with it.rinfo() here
494// }
495//
496// A mask can be specified to skip unwanted modes.
497template <typename RelocInfoT>
498class RelocIteratorBase {
499 public:
500 static constexpr int kAllModesMask = -1;
501
502 RelocIteratorBase(RelocIteratorBase&&) V8_NOEXCEPT = default;
503 RelocIteratorBase(const RelocIteratorBase&) = delete;
504 RelocIteratorBase& operator=(const RelocIteratorBase&) = delete;
505
506 bool done() const { return done_; }
507 void next();
508
509 // The returned pointer is valid until the next call to next().
510 RelocInfoT* rinfo() {
511 DCHECK(!done());
512 return &rinfo_;
513 }
514
515 protected:
516 V8_INLINE RelocIteratorBase(RelocInfoT reloc_info, const uint8_t* pos,
517 const uint8_t* end, int mode_mask);
518
519 // Used for efficiently skipping unwanted modes.
520 bool SetMode(RelocInfo::Mode mode) {
521 if ((mode_mask_ & (1 << mode)) == 0) return false;
522 rinfo_.rmode_ = mode;
523 return true;
524 }
525
526 RelocInfo::Mode GetMode() const {
527 return static_cast<RelocInfo::Mode>((*pos_ >> detail::kTagBits) &
528 ((1 << detail::kLongTagBits) - 1));
529 }
530
531 void Advance(int bytes = 1) { pos_ -= bytes; }
532 int AdvanceGetTag() { return *--pos_ & detail::kTagMask; }
533 void AdvanceReadLongPCJump();
534 void AdvanceReadPC() { rinfo_.pc_ += *--pos_; }
535 void AdvanceReadInt();
536
537 void ReadShortTaggedPC() { rinfo_.pc_ += *pos_ >> detail::kTagBits; }
538 void ReadShortData();
539
540 const uint8_t* pos_;
541 const uint8_t* const end_;
542 RelocInfoT rinfo_;
543 bool done_ = false;
544 const int mode_mask_;
545};
546
547extern template class EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE)
548 RelocIteratorBase<RelocInfo>;
549extern template class EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE)
550 RelocIteratorBase<WritableRelocInfo>;
551
552class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE RelocIterator : public RelocIteratorBase<RelocInfo> {
553 public:
554 // Prefer using this ctor when possible:
555 explicit RelocIterator(Tagged<InstructionStream> istream, int mode_mask);
556 // Convenience wrapper.
557 explicit RelocIterator(Tagged<Code> code, int mode_mask = kAllModesMask);
558
559 // For Wasm.
560 explicit RelocIterator(base::Vector<uint8_t> instructions,
561 base::Vector<const uint8_t> reloc_info,
562 Address const_pool, int mode_mask = kAllModesMask);
563 // For the disassembler.
564 explicit RelocIterator(const CodeReference code_reference);
565 // For FinalizeEmbeddedCodeTargets when creating embedded builtins.
566 explicit RelocIterator(EmbeddedData* embedded_data, Tagged<Code> code,
567 int mode_mask);
568
569 RelocIterator(RelocIterator&&) V8_NOEXCEPT = default;
570 RelocIterator(const RelocIterator&) = delete;
571 RelocIterator& operator=(const RelocIterator&) = delete;
572
573 private:
574 RelocIterator(Address pc, Address constant_pool, const uint8_t* pos,
575 const uint8_t* end, int mode_mask);
576};
577
578class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE WritableRelocIterator
579 : public RelocIteratorBase<WritableRelocInfo> {
580 public:
581 // Constructor for iterating InstructionStreams.
582 WritableRelocIterator(WritableJitAllocation& jit_allocation,
583 Tagged<InstructionStream> istream,
584 Address constant_pool, int mode_mask);
585 // Constructor for iterating Wasm code.
586 WritableRelocIterator(WritableJitAllocation& jit_allocation,
587 base::Vector<uint8_t> instructions,
588 base::Vector<const uint8_t> reloc_info,
589 Address constant_pool, int mode_mask = kAllModesMask);
590};
